info.title: Portalnesia
info.description: REST API to access Portalnesia services

x-codeSamples.label: Shell + Curl
x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://api.portalnesia.com/v1/blog/dashboard?page=1&per_page=15' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --header 'PN-Client-Id: Your client id'

x-codeSamples.label: Node + Axios
Javascript + Xhr
Php + Curl
x-codeSamples.source:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.portalnesia.com/v1/blog/dashboard?page=1&per_page=15",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN",
    "PN-Client-Id: Your client id"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

x-codeSamples.label: Python + Python3
x-codeSamples.source:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("api.portalnesia.com")

headers = {
    'PN-Client-Id': "Your client id",
    'Authorization': "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN"
    }

conn.request("GET", "/v1/blog/dashboard?page=1&per_page=15", headers=headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

x-codeSamples.label: Java + Unirest
x-codeSamples.source:
HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.get("https://api.portalnesia.com/v1/blog/dashboard?page=1&per_page=15")
  .header("PN-Client-Id", "Your client id")
  .header("Authorization", "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN")
  .asString();

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description:
Number of total data per page.   
Default 15   
Max 50

can_load.description: Status if this list have next page

x-codeSamples.label: Shell + Curl
x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.portalnesia.com/v1/blog \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN' \
  --header 'PN-Client-Id: Your client id' \
  --header 'content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
  --data 'title=Test+blog' \
  --data slug=test-blog \
  --data 'text=%3Cp%3EHello+World%3C%2Fp%3E' \
  --data image=https%3A%2F%2Fcontent.portalnesia.com%2F... \
  --data format=html \
  --data tags=Blog%2CDevelopment \
  --data category=uncategory

x-codeSamples.label: Node + Axios
Javascript + Xhr
Php + Curl
x-codeSamples.source:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.portalnesia.com/v1/blog",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "title=Test%2Bblog&slug=test-blog&text=%253Cp%253EHello%2BWorld%253C%252Fp%253E&image=https%253A%252F%252Fcontent.portalnesia.com%252F...&format=html&tags=Blog%252CDevelopment&category=uncategory",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN",
    "PN-Client-Id: Your client id",
    "content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

x-codeSamples.label: Python + Python3
x-codeSamples.source:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("api.portalnesia.com")

payload = "title=Test%2Bblog&slug=test-blog&text=%253Cp%253EHello%2BWorld%253C%252Fp%253E&image=https%253A%252F%252Fcontent.portalnesia.com%252F...&format=html&tags=Blog%252CDevelopment&category=uncategory"

headers = {
    'PN-Client-Id': "Your client id",
    'Authorization': "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN",
    'content-type': "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"
    }

conn.request("POST", "/v1/blog", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

x-codeSamples.label: Java + Unirest
x-codeSamples.source:
HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.post("https://api.portalnesia.com/v1/blog")
  .header("PN-Client-Id", "Your client id")
  .header("Authorization", "Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN")
  .header("content-type", "application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
  .body("title=Test%2Bblog&slug=test-blog&text=%253Cp%253EHello%2BWorld%253C%252Fp%253E&image=https%253A%252F%252Fcontent.portalnesia.com%252F...&format=html&tags=Blog%252CDevelopment&category=uncategory")
  .asString();

slug.description:
Slug URL   
Slugify format (lowercase and space replaced by `-`)

image.description:
Poster image of blog   
Any image URL   
Default `null`

tags.description:
Tags of blog   
comma separate.   
Default `""`

category.description:
Blog category    
Get list of category in [`/v1/category/list`](#get-/v1/blog/category/list)    
Default `uncategory`

$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

post.description:
Allows the authenticated user to follow another user.

If the target user is private, this endpoint will send a follow request.

The request succeeds with no action when the authenticated user sends a request to a user they're already following, or if they're sending a follower request to a private user and that user has not accepted the friend request.

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.portalnesia.com/v1/user/username/media?page=1&per_page=15",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer REPLACE_BEARER_TOKEN",
    "PN-Client-Id: Your client id"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

OauthUser.description: OAuth2 with user based authentication that include user authorization. With this authentication, you can access all of the endpoints, especially endpoints that can access user resources.

scopes.blog: Access blog endpoint, have read and write access to user's blog
scopes.comments: Access comments endpoint, have read and write access to user's comments
scopes.chord: Access chord endpoint, have read access to user's chord
scopes.files: Access files endpoint, have read and write access to user's files
scopes.likes: Access likes endpoint, have read and write access to user's likes
scopes.messages: Access messages endpoint, have read and write access to user's messages
scopes.quiz: Access quiz endpoint, have read access to user's messages
scopes.toko: Access toko endpoint, have read and write access to user's toko
scopes.twibbon: Access twibbon endpoint, have read and write access to user's twibbon
scopes.url-shortener: Access url shortener endpoint, have read and write access to user's url shortener
scopes.user: Access user endpoint, have read and write access to user's following, follower, profile, media

OauthClient.description:
OAuth2 with client based authentication. This flow is used in **server-to-server** authentication.   
Since this flow does not include authorization, ONLY endpoints that do not access user information can be accessed.
